bibdata.title: Refactors the RSpec test suites and introduces Alma test fixtures

comments.body: I have shifted work to a differed (rebased) branch (https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/compare/alma...issues-1204-jrgriffiniii-replace-fixtures-fixed), and I am waiting to ensure that the test suites are passing: https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/pulibrary/bibdata?branch=issues-1204-jrgriffiniii-replace-fixtures-fixed
I am sorry, I am deprecating this again in favor of https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/pull/1474

Some pointers to a previous siege I did against catalog searches:
- The issue was https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_solr/issues/174
- The code to generate the random search urls is at https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_solr/tree/main/scripts
- Based on the comment in that issue a good command to start with might be `$ siege --concurrent=25 --time=5m --file=urls.txt`

Note that in this case we do want to make sure we get javascript files, and in fact we want them to execute. If it's not possible to execute the JS then I'm not sure how much value we'll get out of this exercise -- the webserver infrastructure is identical to what we currently have so we know there's not a load issue there.

bibdata.title: Updated refactoring for the RSpec test suites and the introduction of Alma test fixtures

dspace-development.title: As a data curator, I want to run basic data validation on files while on Tigress, without having to download them to my local machine
Add gender-inclusive terminology for hint text in the Messages.properties file
E-Persons should be encoded with UTF-8
Updating submission forms to reflect industry standards
Shift latest PRDS metadata to dataspace
Point old documentation to ETD site
Update documentation with new server location
Update Task Pool entries for member Lib_DigPub_Reviewers and Lib_DigPub_Approvers

comments.body:
This might be best structured in the following manner:

```ruby

group_names = [
  "Lib_DigPubs_Submitters",
  "Lib_DigPubs_Reviewers"
]

def perform(group_name)
  group = org.dspace.eperson.Group.findByName(DSpace.context, group_name)
  members = org.dspace.eperson.Group.allMembers(DSpace.context, group)

  items = []
  members.to_a.each do |member|
    objects = org.dspace.workflow.WorkflowItem.findByEPerson(DSpace.context, member)
    items << objects
  end

  members.to_a.each do |member|
    objects = org.dspace.workflow.WorkflowItem.findByEPerson(DSpace.context, member)
    delta = items.uniq - objects
    workflows = objects.to_a.map { |obj| DSpace::CLI::WorkflowItem.new(obj) }
    workflows.each { |workflow| workflow.add_task_pool_user(member.getEmail) }
  end
end

group_names.each { |group_name| perform(group_name) }
```

princeton_ansible.title: [Bibdata] set alma-staging to pull scsb partner files from prod

comments.body:
The siege command I used for this work was:
`$ siege --concurrent=25 --time=5m --no-parser --file=urls.txt`

Turning off the parser stops it from downloading images and js files and stuff -- in this case I wanted that because I was trying to stress solr and not the webserver. The time switch tells it to just go for that long and then stop.
